data.title: Disqualified Athletes and Countries from Olympics till 2024
data.meta_description: Explore the complete list of athletes and countries disqualified from the Olympics due to rule violations, including doping offences, weight category issues, and more.
data.text:
The Paris Olympics 2024 has captivated audiences globally, but for Indian fans and Vinesh Phogat, the excitement was short-lived. The talented wrestler's Olympic journey came to an abrupt end with her disqualification from the competition. This unfortunate turn of events adds to the list of countries facing Olympic bans and athletes stripped of their medals, leaving fans and competitors alike reeling from the consequences of rule violations.

ALSO READ| List of Indian Athletes Qualified for Paris Olympics 2024

Disqualified Athletes and Countries from the Olympics till 2024

The International Olympic Committee (IOC) has officially rescinded the following Olympic medals, upholding the principles of fairness and integrity in the Olympic Games. Notably, team medals are counted singularly, irrespective of team size or the number of disqualified members.

The revocation of a team medal typically entails the return of multiple physical medals, with each team member required to surrender their medal. Unless explicitly stated otherwise, a revoked team medal signifies the entire team's disqualification from the event due to infractions committed by one or more team members. This list underscores the IOC's commitment to enforcing rules and regulations in competitive sports, serving as a reminder of the importance of ethical conduct in Olympic competitions. Why did Vinesh Phogat get disqualified?

On the second day of her weigh-in, Vinesh Phogat faced a setback, tipping the scales slightly above the required limit by a mere 100 grams. Despite her valiant efforts to shed the excess weight, including skipping meals and running, she struggled to meet the target. Vinesh reportedly went without sleep the entire night, hoping to make the weight category. Indian officials also appealed to the Olympic committee for an extension, but unfortunately, their efforts were unsuccessful.
